articles.title: Study: Living Near Green Space Makes You 2.5 Years Younger - Voice of America - VOA News
articles.description: Exposure to green spaces has previously been linked with better cardiovascular health, lower rates of mortality; new study goes a step further
articles.content:
washington  WASHINGTON - City parks and green spaces help counter heat, boost biodiversity and instill a sense of calm in the urban jungle - and they also help slow biological aging, a study found.

articles.title: Easier access to opioid medicines could lower opioid-related deaths: Study - ETHealthWorld
articles.description: America's opioid crisis has evolved across several waves, with each increasingly fatal. Wave one, which began in the 1990s, was associated with overdose deaths because of the misuse of opioid medications.
